law.text: If a death is presumed to have occurred within the Commonwealth but the body cannot be located or recovered, a death certificate may be prepared by the state registrar upon receipt of an order of a court of competent jurisdiction, which shall include the finding of facts required to complete the death certificate. Such a death certificate shall be marked "presumptive" and shall show on the certificate the date of registration and shall identify the court and the date of decree.
law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 369, sec. 16, effective July 13, 1990.
